context: "..a single software solution across all domains.."  Let's just hope an enemy doesn't find a way to hack into it, and turn the machines against us.
Are these drone ships like the Sea Hunter stealthy? Or is that too expensive? It seems to me from the picture above that it is big enough to be readily located by radar.
The difference between us & Russia is:  We have the hardware and then say we don't, Russia says they have the hardware, but they really don't.

The one thing about ships like this are that the whole thing can be geared up for weapons. No need for a ships mess or berths or water supply or heat or air. Just armed to the gills. Awesome long overdue!
what happens when the first attack is the satellite that controls them? or jamming the frequency?
the Navy ought to make these things explode when rammed by another enemy vessel.
Where were the un manned patrol boats when I was in Viet Nam?  Great idea
Just hope the droid control ship doesn't get destroyed by some kid in a star fighter.

Ok guys..... What is to prevent an unfriendly ship (but under circumstances that the US command is hesitant to shoot at) from just tying onto one of these with a good strong rope and hauling it off to THEIR country to study, copy, and learn how to defeat?

replies.context: you mean like china already has done before?

context: Sure hope they have good security. You can bet the Chinese are looking for data on this.
